Title: Bounding Box ID Overflow Causing Robot Collisions

Description:
Bounding box identifiers currently reset at 4,096 due to a hardcoded limit in the ID allocator.
This overflow is causing ID duplication, resulting in robot collisions during path planning and shared environment tasks.

Proposed Fix:
Increase the ID range to 32,767 to align with int16 safe limits.
Implement a modulo-based collision check to ensure no two active bounding boxes share the same ID within the session.
Impact: Affects all robots operating in shared workspaces with more than 4,096 active objects.
High risk of damage and mission failure if not addressed.
